Hi All,
Can someone please help me here. I am trying to use @distributed loop to assign values to one array. However, with multiple workers, the code is running slower and using much more allocations.

Thanks

Here is the code.

```using BenchmarkTools, Distributed
addprocs(4)
@everywhere using SharedArrays

println( "nWorkers: ", nworkers() )
println( "nThreads: ", Threads.nthreads() )

function calc_loop( nk::Int, x::SharedArray)
    for n=1:nk
        for i=1:size(x)[1]
            for j=1:size(x)[2]
                for k=1:size(x)[3]
                    x[i,j,k] = 1.0
                end
            end
        end      
    end
    return x
end

function calc_loop_parallel( nk::Int, x::SharedArray)
    for n=1:nk
        @sync @distributed  for i=1:size(x)[1]
            for j=1:size(x)[2]
                for k=1:size(x)[3]
                    x[i,j,k] = 1.0
                end
            end
        end 
    end
    return x
end


N = 100
a = SharedArray{Float32,3}(N, N, N)

for i=1:4
    @time calc_loop( 2, a)
    println( "Sum: ", sum(a) )
    @time calc_loop_parallel( 10, a)
    println( "Sum (parallel): ", sum(a) )

    println("----------------")
end```

No i don't think it affects number of allocations, but you are killing the cache locality if you write in a "bad" order like this. Allocations aren't the only thing that can make your code slow. This is irrespective of distributed arrays or not.
I'm not very familiar with SharedArrays and Distributed in Julia, so I can't give specific recommendations there.
